comments.body: Is it worth while to pull in the k8s.io/cloud-provider dependency here if this constant is not likely to change anytime in the future?
I did it due to the above discussion: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/90734#discussion_r420958493 Just in case people would look for the port
We're claiming a port.  @liggitt does that require an api review or something?
why don't we use these constants to generate the strings in the defaults above?
Should we use this define in Kubelet? (the dependency is not one we expect, but there is value in standardizing the source for the default ports.)

I was confused about the port definitions here but tried to follow the existing convention. 

ProxyPort (which I renamed to ProxyStatusPort because it's only used for the healthz server) isn't actually referenced anywhere in the code base. Neither is KubeletStatusPort (which I added here). I added it to make the port reservation clear but didn't introduce a package dependency from the kubelet to the master. 

A reasonable alternative would be to rip out these unused variables.
That or have some package that defined these for other packages to use (neither of which affects this PR).
